programme.title: Little Woods

programme.title: From Russia With Love
programme.desc: Agent 007 (Sean Connery) lands in Istanbul with a Russian beauty (Daniela Bianchi), a pawn in SPECTRE's plot to kill him.

programme.title: Goldfinger
programme.desc: Agent 007 (Sean Connery) drives an Aston Martin, runs into Oddjob and fights Goldfinger's (Gert Frobe) scheme to rob Fort Knox.

programme.title: On Her Majesty's Secret Service
programme.desc: Agent 007 (George Lazenby) proposes to a contessa (Diana Rigg) and foils SPECTRE chief Blofeld's (Telly Savalas) agricultural plot.

programme.title: Live and Let Die
programme.desc: Agent 007 (Roger Moore) charms a tarot reader (Jane Seymour) in Jamaica on the voodoo/heroin trail of Mr. Big (Yaphet Kotto).

programme.title: The Spy Who Loved Me
programme.desc: Agent 007 (Roger Moore) and a Russian beauty (Barbara Bach) foil a madman (Curt Jurgens) in a submarine, who is out to nuke the world.

programme.title: For Your Eyes Only
programme.desc: Agent 007 (Roger Moore) skis the Alps, skin-dives in Greece and hunts spies with the daughter (Carole Bouquet) of a slain agent.

programme.title: The Visit
programme.desc: A teen (Olivia DeJonge) and her younger brother (Ed Oxenbould) discover a shocking secret about their seemingly charming grandparents while staying at their remote Pennsylvania farm.

programme.title: Victor Frankenstein
programme.desc: When the experiments of radical scientist Victor Frankenstein (James McAvoy) go too far, only Igor Strausman (Daniel Radcliffe), his equally brilliant protégé, can bring him back from the brink of madness and save him from his monstrous creation.

programme.title: Wes Craven Presents: Dracula 2000
programme.desc: A London antiques dealer (Christopher Plummer) travels to New Orleans to save his estranged daughter from his nemesis, Count Dracula (Gerard Butler).

programme.title: Conviction
programme.desc: Following the imprisonment of her brother (Sam Rockwell), a woman (Hilary Swank) earns a law degree and fights to clear him of murder.

programme.title: Bandits
programme.desc: Two bank robbers (Bruce Willis, Billy Bob Thornton) fall for a bored housewife (Cate Blanchett) who helps them commit heists across the country.

programme.title: The Captive
programme.desc: Eight years after a child disappeared without a trace, detectives find disturbing clues that indicate that the girl is still alive.

programme.title: Source Code
programme.desc: A helicopter pilot (Jake Gyllenhaal) takes part in a secret government program that enables him to assume someone's identity and experience the last few minutes of that person's life.

programme.title: The Thomas Crown Affair

programme.title: Altitude
programme.desc: An FBI agent finds herself choosing sides between two factions of a criminal gang while trying to keep her hijacked plane from going down.

programme.title: Friday the 13th
programme.desc: The reopening of Camp Crystal Lake spells murder and mayhem for a group of sexually promiscuous counselors.

programme.title: Enemy
programme.desc: A mild-mannered college professor (Jake Gyllenhaal) discovers a look-alike actor and delves into the other man's private affairs.

programme.title: The Frozen Ground
programme.desc: A teenage escapee (Vanessa Hudgens) provides a critical break in the case, as an Alaskan detective (Nicolas Cage) hunts a serial killer who has been preying on women for 13 years.

programme.title: Mojave
programme.desc: A down-and-out artist (Garrett Hedlund) has a dangerous and shocking encounter with an evil drifter (Oscar Isaac) in the desert, leading to terrifying consequences when the deadly stranger follows his unsuspecting victim home.

programme.title: McQueen
programme.desc: Archival footage and interviews with friends and family offer insight into the extraordinary life and career of British fashion designer Alexander McQueen.

programme.title: McQueen

programme.title: The End of the Tour

programme.title: Get Shorty
programme.desc: A film-loving loan shark (John Travolta) teams with a B-movie producer (Gene Hackman) to become a Hollywood mogul.

programme.title: Scott Pilgrim vs. the World
programme.desc: After meeting the gal (Mary Elizabeth Winstead) of his dreams, a charming slacker (Michael Cera) must contend with an army of her ex-boyfriends, wanting to get rid of him.

programme.title: The Bourne Ultimatum
programme.desc: Jason Bourne (Matt Damon) continues his international quest to uncover his true identity while staying one step ahead of those who want to kill him.

programme.title: Body of Lies
programme.desc: A CIA operative (Leonardo DiCaprio) hatches a dangerous plan to catch the leader of a terrorist organization, but conflicts with his two closest allies (Russell Crowe, Mark Strong) may cost him his life.

programme.title: Mississippi Grind
programme.desc: Convinced that his newfound friend (Ryan Reynolds) is a good-luck charm, a gambling addict (Ben Mendelsohn) takes the man on a road trip to a high-stakes poker game in New Orleans.

programme.title: Locke
programme.desc: A man's (Tom Hardy) life unravels after he leaves a construction site at a critical time and drives to London to be present for the birth of a child conceived during a one-night stand.

programme.title: The Strangers: Prey at Night
programme.desc: A road trip to visit relatives takes a dangerous turn when a family arrives at a secluded mobile home park that's mysteriously deserted -- until three masked psychopaths show up to satisfy their thirst for blood.

programme.title: Fargo
programme.desc: A pregnant police chief (Frances McDormand) probes the murderous events that evolved from a desperate car salesman's (William H. Macy) kidnapping scheme.

programme.title: Be Cool
programme.desc: Chili Palmer (John Travolta) runs afoul of music-industry players when he teams up with a friend's widow (Uma Thurman) to produce a singer's debut album.

programme.title: My Boss's Daughter
programme.desc: To impress a young woman (Tara Reid), a man (Ashton Kutcher) agrees to housesit at his employer's mansion for one night.

programme.title: Barely Lethal
programme.desc: Seeking a normal adolescence, a special-operations agent (Hailee Steinfeld) fakes her own death and enrolls in high school as an exchange student.

programme.title: The New World
programme.desc: Explorer John Smith (Colin Farrell) lands in 17th-century North America.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: Bill and the team get their chance to finish a 1968 Chevy C10, which they turn into a unibody by welding the body and bed into one piece; an old dump truck rolls into the shop as the biggest truck the team has ever customized.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: A 1996 dump truck is the largest truck the shop has ever customized; the guys go extra heavy duty to create a military-styled megatruck; a lowrider enthusiast wants a custom air ride and LS swap for his pristine 1934 Buick.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: Freiburger and Dulcich give some much-needed love to the '69 Chevy Crusher Impala by way of a new 9-inch rear and a suspension overhaul. They also fix a major throttle issue that unlocks the 498 big block before hitting the road for monster burnouts.

programme.title: Motorhead Garage
programme.desc: Garage guests bring high-quality brakes at affordable prices, and John Gardner shows why keeping a turbocharger lubricated is so important.

programme.title: FantomWorks
programme.desc: Chris asks FantomWorks to breathe new life into a 1951 Mercury Woody that was sitting in a chicken coop for thirty years; Dan's 1970 Mustang Boss arrives with a long list of problems and the speed of a sea slug.

programme.title: Two Guys Garage
programme.desc: Kevin and Willie bring in a C3 Corvette that needs some AC repair; the owner hears some noise in the rear end that needs to be addressed; they fix a headlight winking problem.

programme.title: Truck U
programme.desc: A veteran who always helps others owns an orange TJ; the team returns the favor and get some things done that he had put off, and reinforce the body inside and out, and add some much-needed armor and recovery.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: A 1937 International Harvester gets a big old Cummins 12-valve diesel engine that's as heavy as the truck itself; a 2005 Chevy Colorado gets a new lease on life as a nitrous-infused drag truck.

programme.title: FourWheeler
programme.desc: The new Bronco Raptor is expensive, so Ian is going to build his own; he takes an '80s box-style Bronco and adds a wider fiberglass body kit front and rear to give this classic Bronco a modern Raptor look.

programme.title: FourWheeler
programme.desc: Ian finds a way to get 40-inch tires under a Toyota FJ by cutting out all of the stock suspension and installing a solid-axle conversion.

programme.title: Truck U
programme.desc: The owner of a C10 did nice work on his truck himself, but he ran out of time to finish the interior, wiring and some work on the drivetrain; Matt and Bruno pick up the slack and get his C10 closer to the finish line.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: David Freiburger and Mike Finnegan are back in the junkyard to take the front half of two separate four-wheel-drive vehicles and combine them into one, making one of David's dream schemes come to life.

programme.title: Faster With Newbern and Cotten
programme.desc: The guys take Dave's blown, big-block '57 Bel Air to compete in the autocross at Cruisin' the Coast in Mississippi. With a complete overhaul of the suspension in the event's parking lot, the guys find out how much time they can shave in a weekend.

programme.title: Faster With Newbern and Cotten
programme.desc: Off-road legend Cameron Steele warned the guys that a V-8 swap wouldn't cut as much time as a long-travel suspension could; now Newbern and Cotten finally heed his advice, going all-out with major suspension upgrades to their Baja-inspired VW Beetle.

programme.title: Faster With Newbern and Cotten
programme.desc: The guys take on Clay Millican by transforming a Model A from the ground up; with a new chassis, suspension and fresh 400-hp 347ci V-8, the Ford is improved in every way.

programme.title: Faster With Newbern and Cotten
programme.desc: Newbern and Cotten discover a gem which is not a typical American muscle with a turbocharged Eagle Talon; Shea Seefeldt challenges the guys on a rally course with his LS-swapped Subaru.

programme.title: Faster With Newbern and Cotten
programme.desc: Newbern surprises Cotten with a mint 1984 G-body and an '80s-style, stock-car-inspired build to take on an actual former cup car around the circle track.

programme.title: Faster With Newbern and Cotten
programme.desc: Cotten's Pro Street big-block 1980 Dodge Mirada's engine engine dies on Roadkill; things don't go as planned as the guys attempt to add a giant blower and bigger tires, and bring the car back to its 1990s-era glory.

programme.title: Shorty's Dream Shop

programme.desc: Having fallen in love with this beat-up old '78 Chevy K20 as a teenager, this farm girl knew she had to have it; after a tough year, the Garage Squad is called on to help her and her truck start a new chapter in life.
